docs.lead_paragraph: New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman will propose legislation on Thursday that he says would make the state's data security law the strongest in the country and require "unprecedented safeguards" for personal data.

docs.lead_paragraph: Not only do more Americans have health insurance, but the number struggling with medical costs has dropped since President Barack Obama's health care law expanded coverage, according to a study released Thursday.

headline.main: Study: Fewer Struggle With Medical Costs as Coverage Grows
headline.print_headline: Study: Fewer Struggle With Medical Costs as Coverage Grows

docs.snippet: Not only do more Americans have health insurance, but the number struggling with medical costs has dropped since President Barack Obama's health care law expanded coverage, according to a study released Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A major goal of the Affordable Care Act was to improve the financial security of previously uninsured people. A new survey suggests this is happening.

headline.main: Signs of a Decline in Financial Distress Connected to Medical Bills
headline.print_headline: Distress Appears to Ease Over Cost of Health Care

docs.abstract: The Upshot; Commonwealth Fund survey finds number of Americans having financial problems over their medical bills has started to drop, giving new evidence that Affordable Care Act is helping improve financial security for individuals and families, a major goal of the law.
docs.snippet: A major goal of the Affordable Care Act was to improve the financial security of previously uninsured people. A new survey suggests this is happening.

headline.print_headline: A Business Collapse Froze His Income, and Then the Pharmacy Bills Came

docs.lead_paragraph: We perversely encourage high prices. It’s not that hard to fix.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Dr Peter B Bach discusses problem of costs of high-priced drugs being passed on to patients; suggests either insurance companies and government programs be free from having to include all expensive drugs in their plans, or insist that drug prices be equal to lower European prices.
docs.snippet: We perversely encourage high prices. It’s not that hard to fix.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Washington saloniste has not let setbacks keep her from her passion: collecting African and African-American art.

headline.main: Peggy Cooper Cafritz: Everything in a Big Way

docs.abstract: Art patron and saloniste Peggy Cooper Cafritz has spent last five years creating new art-filled home in Washington, DC, after fire destroyed her old one.
docs.snippet: The Washington saloniste has not let setbacks keep her from her passion: collecting African and African-American art.

docs.lead_paragraph: MiniLuxe, applying best practices from other industries, has eight locations in the Boston area and is preparing to expand nationally.

headline.main: Rethinking the Nail Salon by Glancing at the Starbucks Model
headline.print_headline: Rethinking the Nail Salon by Glancing at the Starbucks Model

docs.abstract: Miniluxe, small chain of nail salons in Boston area, has secured $24 million in venture capital and has plans to expand nationally; company has adapted practices used in other industries to create salons that are cleaner and more sophisticated, but slightly more expensive, looking to Starbucks as an industry model.
docs.snippet: MiniLuxe, applying best practices from other industries, has eight locations in the Boston area and is preparing to expand nationally.
